Key Match Events: Anthony Edwards hit nine 3-pointers and scored 37 points to help the Minnesota Timberwolves beat the Portland Trail Blazers 127-102.
Julius Randle scored 22 points and Rudy Gobert had eight points, 15 rebounds and three blocks for Minnesota.
Scoot Henderson led the Blazers with 16 points.
Anfernee Simons had 14 points and Robert Williams III added 13 points for the Blazers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Portland was playing its eighth game in seven different cities in 13 days.
The Timberwolves made a season-high 22 3-pointers on 50 attempts.
The Blazers were held scoreless for the first 5:12 of the game, missing 11 field-goal attempts in that stretch.
